page.title: 18FARMING IN HOLMER GREEN
page.content: Farming is an important occupation within our grid square.Wycombe Heath Farm is owned by Alan Pitcher,he owns 67 acres of pastoral land with no woodland.On the farm there are about 180 cows 0f which 80 are dairy,100 are beef.The machinery includes 6 tractors, a bailer,a jugler,haybob,fertilizer, spinner.Blair Avon Farm is owned by Ivor Cook.He owns 85 acres which until 1952 was cherry orchard.The farm is arable,grows wheat,barley,oats,linseed, peas.They have no woodland.They have 5 tractors and a combine harvester. Hoppers Farm is 49 acres,the owners are British United Turkeys Ltd.The manager is Mr Parsons.It is a turkey farm and sells 10 million eggs a year to 51 countries.16 acres is used as grassland and then sold as hay to other farms. They breed 53,000 turkeys a year have 2.25 million day old chicks.
